meanings.definition: A person engaged in physical work, especially for wages.
meanings.sent1: The laborer carried heavy boxes at the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The construction site hired many laborers to help build the new houses.
meanings.sent3: The tired laborer joked that their muscles were going on strike.
meanings.sent4: She was a true laborer, building her dreams brick by brick.
meanings.sent5: The laborer's hands bore the marks of hard work and dedication.

meanings.sent1: He had to laborer all day under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: She labored over her homework until late at night.
meanings.sent3: The chef continued to laborer in the kitchen, perfecting his signature dish.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to laborer on as she waited for the test results.
meanings.sent5: The ants labored tirelessly to gather food for the winter ahead.
